translation.title: A Realized One Neither Exists Nor Doesn’t Exist

previous.name: A Realized One Both Exists and Doesn’t Exist

segments.en: Linked Discourses 24
1. Stream-Entry
18. A Realized One Neither Exists Nor Doesn’t Exist
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: “Kismiṃ nu kho, bhikkhave, sati, kiṃ upādāya, kiṃ abhinivissa evaṃ diṭṭhi uppajjati:
segments.en: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does the view arise:

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti, na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti?
segments.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’?”
“Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”

segments.pli: “Rūpe kho, bhikkhave, sati, rūpaṃ upādāya, rūpaṃ abhinivissa evaṃ diṭṭhi uppajjati:
segments.en: “When form exists, because of grasping form and insisting on form, the view arises:

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti, na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti … pe ….
segments.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’ …
What do you think, mendicants?
Is form permanent or impermanent?”
“Impermanent, sir.” …

segments.pli: vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, api nu taṃ anupādāya evaṃ diṭṭhi uppajjeyya:
segments.en: “But by not grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would the view arise:

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti, na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti?
segments.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’?”
“No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yampidaṃ diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā tampi niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā”ti?
segments.en: “That which is seen, heard, thought, known, sought, and explored by the mind: is that permanent or impermanent?”
“Impermanent, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vā taṃ sukhaṃ vā”ti?
segments.en: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
“Suffering, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, api nu taṃ anupādāya evaṃ diṭṭhi uppajjeyya:
segments.en: “But by not grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would the view arise:

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti, na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’”ti?
segments.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’?”
“No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yato kho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvakassa imesu ca ṭhānesu kaṅkhā pahīnā hoti, dukkhepissa kaṅkhā pahīnā hoti, dukkhasamudayepissa kaṅkhā pahīnā hoti, dukkhanirodhepissa kaṅkhā pahīnā hoti, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāyapissa kaṅkhā pahīnā hoti—
segments.en: “When a noble disciple has given up doubt in these six cases, and has given up doubt in suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation,

segments.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano”ti.
segments.en: they’re called a noble disciple who is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”

segments.pli: so attā no ca me siyā;
Anantavā ca taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīranti,
Neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti.

suttaplex.blurb: The view that the Realized One neither exists nor does not exist after death is given up by seeing the aggregates, as well as what is seen, heard, thought, and known, as impermanent.
